sec.title: What Is Comparative Education?
sec.p: In one sense, all evaluations of education are comparative.

fn.p: Martin Carnoy, “The Costs and Returns to Education in Mexico” (PhD diss., University of Chicago, 1964).
Martin Carnoy and Hans Thias,Cost‐Benefit Analysis in Education: A Case Study of Kenya(Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, for World Bank, 1972).
